page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: I travelled with three of my classmates with our teacher in his car to visit our 'patch'. We were simply driving around the area to see what kind of countryside we were going to investigate. Our teacher, Mr. Wright, stopped his car on the crest of a hill and we surveyed the land. We were surrounded by farmland: barley fields, grazing land for cows and sheep, and some forested areas. As far as the eye could see there were trees, fields, green valleys and not a house in sight. It looked a lonely, quiet area and very different from the built up housing area where I live. I think, certainly at the moment I'd prefer to live in our area where there's more life and more to do. At first glance I didn't think there was much to see but I could see from the map I was wrong.
